data.title: John Napier Wyndham Turner (1929-2020)

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Education

1.2 Political Career

2 Sources

2.1 See Also

Biography

John Turner is Notable.

John Napier Wyndham Turner was born in Richmond, Surrey, England to Leonard Turner and Mary Gregory. [1][2] He died 19 Sep 2020 in Toronto, Ontario, Canada[3]

Education

He was educated at the University of British Columbia, entering in 1945 at age 16. While there he entered the ranks of Canada's elite runners and qualified for the 1948 Olympics but he was unable to compete.[2] After graduating from the University of British Columbia he attended Magdalen College at Oxford University where he earned several degrees in Law.[2] He returned to Canada and practiced law in Québec.

Political Career

In 1962, he ran for office and won a seat becoming an MP in Québec. In 1967 he became Minister of Consumer and Corporate Affairs in Prime Minister Pearson's cabinet.[2]

John was appointed Prime Minister in June of 1984 and was sworn in on 30 June 1984. Almost immediately after being sworn in he asked that Parliament be dissolved and that a new election be scheduled for September. On 4 September 1984, the Liberals lost ending his tenure as Prime Minister.[2]

Sources

↑ in 1929 "England and Wales Birth Registration Index, 1837-2008," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QV3L-BBC5 : 2 October 2014), John N W Turner, 1929; from "England & Wales Births, 1837-2006," database, findmypast (http://www.findmypast.com : 2012); citing Birth Registration, Richmond (Surrey), Surrey, England, citing General Register Office, Southport, England. He married in 1963.
